title: Understanding $$f(x-h)$$
text: For some value $$h$$, $$f(x-h)$$ means that f(x) is translated to the right by $$h$$ units. Similarly, $$f{\left(x+h\right)}$$ means that f(x) is translated to the left by $$h$$ units.
speech: For some value ; h , , f of, open paren x minus h, close paren;  means that f(x) is translated to the right by  h  units. Similarly, , f of, open paren x plus h, close paren;  means that f(x) is translated to the left by  h;  units.

title: Understanding $$f(x-h)$$
text: Since $$h$$ is $$4$$, $$f(x-4)$$ means that the graph is translated four units to the right.
speech: Since ; h  is  4 , , f of, open paren x minus 4, close paren;  means that the graph is translated four units to the right.

title: Understanding $$f(x-h)$$
speech: ; f of, open paren x minus 4, close paren;  means that  f of 4; is equal to, 2 ,  f of 6, is equal to, 0 , and  f of 8, is equal to 1; .
